pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:5.1: 49. The training rule on studying pointless knowledge
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:6.2: At that time the nuns from the group of six were studying pointless knowledge.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:6.4: “How can nuns study pointless knowledge? They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:7.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:7.4: “How can the nuns from the group of six study pointless knowledge?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:7.5: “Is it true, monks, those nuns do that?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:7.8: How can the nuns from the group of six study pointless knowledge?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:7.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:7.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:8.1: ‘If a nun studies pointless knowledge, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:10.2: whatever is external to the Buddha’s Teaching, not connected with what is beneficial.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:11.2: if she learns by the line, then for every line she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:11.3: If she learns by the syllable, then for every syllable she commits an offense entailing confession.
